response.original_title: How do I stop Norton charging my credit card? {Ask^Expert}
response.overview: The most effective way (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) to stop Norton from charging your credit card is by turning off the Automatic Renewal setting in your account at my.Norton.com. This action (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) ensures that your current protection remains active until the end of your paid term but prevents any future charges. If you have (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) already been charged and need a refund, you must contact Member Services & Support via their official Live Chat or at (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>), as turning off auto-renewal alone (1>::<833>::<743>::<5300>) does not automatically reverse a transaction.
response.title: How do I stop Norton charging my credit card? {Ask^Expert}
